heading: cola wars
subheading: generationext has had it with the real thing. pepsi, in a motion that shows that the software industry does not have a monopoly on antitrust litigation, is taking coca-cola to court. pepsi accuses the cola king of strong-arming food-service distributors who want to supply both cola brands by threatening not to supply distributors who also distribute pepsi products. coca-cola has long maintained a 65 percent share of the fountain market to pepsi's 25. royal crown, anyone?
author: wired staff
